docs.snippet: LEAD:  HOCKEY  Soviet Team Edges Czechoslovakia: Vyacheslav Bykov, a center, scored with 6 minutes 24 seconds left to give the Soviet Union a 1-0 victory over Czechoslovakia yesterday in the opening game of the medal round at the world championships...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: HOCKEY Soviet Team Edges Czechoslovakia: Vyacheslav Bykov, a center, scored with 6 minutes 24 seconds left to give the Soviet Union a 1-0 victory over Czechoslovakia yesterday in the opening game of the medal round at the world championships in Stockholm. In the second game, Team Canada defeated Sweden, the defending champion, by 5-3.(AP)

docs.snippet: LEAD: Raul Sendic, the founder of the leftist Tupamaro guerrilla movement in Uruguay, died late Thursday at a clinic in Paris after a long illness. He was 64 years old and had gone to France several weeks ago from Uruguay seeking treatment.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: What did Pete Sampras, Jaime Yzaga, Bruno Oresar, Eduardo Osta, Udo Riglewski and Josef Cihak have in common yesterday? All were playing first-round matches in the Eagle Tournament of Champions in front of fewer fans than were watching John McEnroe practice. And McEnroe is not even entered in the singles draw.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The United States trade representative, Carla A. Hills, pledged today to combat unfair foreign trade practices ''vigorously and constructively,'' but cautioned that the elimination of foreign barriers would do little to reduce the American trade deficit.

headline.main: Caution Urged in Battle Against Unfair Trading

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A year ago at Forest Hills, Andre Agassi was regarded as a youngster on the rise in a sport dominated by a handful of players who appeared to have secured a lifetime membership in the top 10. He was as new to the fans then as his blue denim shorts were to tennis fashion.

headline.main: Humbler, Agassi Tries To Cope With Success

docs.snippet: LEAD: The second annual Port Washington Tennis Academy Tournament of Champions began play with doubles matches yesterday, featuring the return of John McEnroe, who spent some of his youth on those indoor courts on Long Island. Port Washington redux...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The second annual Port Washington Tennis Academy Tournament of Champions began play with doubles matches yesterday, featuring the return of John McEnroe, who spent some of his youth on those indoor courts on Long Island. Port Washington redux was necessitated by another day of rain at Forest Hills, which forced postponement of the singles quarterfinals.
